snippet: Don’t worry, people. If you missed the heated hearing on the I.R.S. held by the House Ways and Means Committee on Friday, we have a complete rundown.
abstract: Gail Collins Op-Ed column lampoons political motivations during House Ways and Means Committee hearing investigating Internal Revenue Service's targeting of conservative groups; holds if Congress truly wishes to improve fairness at overworked agency, it should simplify laws related to tax-exempt organizations or increase its budget.
